title: Magnetic field at P away from different wires

content.question: Wires are shown in five different configurations below. Option <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>A</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> shows two wires, and all other options show a single wire. For all the configurations, the wires have a current <math alttext="I" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>I</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. For each configuration, a labeled point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> is the same distance <math alttext="d" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>d</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> from the indicated wires. Which of the following configurations creates a magnetic field of the greatest magnitude at point <math alttext="P" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math>?

choices.label: The figure shows two horizontal parallel wires that each direct current to the right. Between them, a point labeled P is indicated, and point P is a distance d from each wire.

The figure shows two horizontal parallel lines separated by a distance d. A wire is drawn which directs current to the right. A point labeled P is indicated on the bottom dashed line. The wire begins at the bottom dashed line, and moves horizontally to the right until it is a distance d to the left of point P. The wire then moves vertically upward until it reaches the top dashed line, then moves horizontally to the right. The wire then moves vertically downward to the bottom dashed line, so that it is a distance d to the right of point P. The wire then continues moving horizontally to the right.

The figure shows two horizontal parallel lines separated by a distance d. A wire is drawn which directs current to the right. A point labeled P is indicated on the bottom dashed line. The wire begins at the top dashed line, and moves horizontally to the right.

The figure shows two horizontal parallel lines separated by a distance d. A wire is drawn which directs current to the right. A point labeled P is indicated on the bottom dashed line. The wire begins at the bottom dashed line, and moves horizontally to the right until it is a distance to the left of point P. The wire then moves in a semicircle around point P, so that it touches the top dashed line at its highest point, then curves back down to the bottom dashed line. The wire then continues moving horizontally to the right.

The figure shows two horizontal parallel lines separated by a distance d. A circular wire is drawn which directs current clockwise. A point labeled P is indicated on the bottom dashed line. The circular wire is positioned such that its center is point P, and it has radius d.

content.answer: The figure shows two horizontal parallel lines separated by a distance d. A circular wire is drawn which directs current clockwise. A point labeled P is indicated on the bottom dashed line. The circular wire is positioned such that its center is point P, and it has radius d.
